meanings.definition: Not producing the desired effect; ineffective.
meanings.sent1: The medicine was inefficacious in relieving his pain.
meanings.sent2: The inefficacious plan led to disappointment.
meanings.sent3: The magician's inefficacious trick left the audience puzzled.
meanings.sent4: Her inefficacious attempts at fixing the leaky faucet only made it worse.
meanings.sent5: The inefficacious potion did nothing to cure the princess's ailment.

meanings.definition: Lacking the ability to achieve a desired result.
meanings.sent1: His inefficacious efforts to lift the heavy box were in vain.
meanings.sent2: The inefficacious tool was unable to cut through the tough material.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel's inefficacious attempts to reach the bird feeder were comical.
meanings.sent4: The key was inefficacious in unlocking the rusty old door.
meanings.sent5: The inefficacious flashlight provided no help in the dark cave.

meanings.definition: Failing to produce the intended outcome.
meanings.sent1: The inefficacious speech failed to inspire the crowd.
meanings.sent2: Her inefficacious studying resulted in a poor grade on the test.
meanings.sent3: The chef's inefficacious recipe left the dish tasteless.
meanings.sent4: The inefficacious negotiation led to a breakdown in communication.
meanings.sent5: The inefficacious plan to save the sinking ship was doomed from the start.
